alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 2:05PM CST until January 05 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. New snow accumulations of one to three inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Greater snow accumulations of three to five inches for the higher elevations of the Bayfield Peninsula. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Carlton and South St. Louis County. In Wisconsin, Douglas, Bayfield, Ashland and Iron Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Fond du Lac Band, the Bad River Reservation and the Red Cliff Band. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Do not use cruise control in winter driving conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
